intro: Epacris serpyllifolia, commonly known as the woolly epacris, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the heath family, Ericaceae, and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage. The plant typically grows in heathlands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces clusters of pink or red flowers during the spring and summer months. Epacris serpyllifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
